Frank, you and your colleges go to an attorney, see if you can paten the  
=
idea for the watch like radio device, then you make one, then you go to a b=
ig 
 university, with the patten your safe noone can steal it away from you=
.   
Then you do scientific testing, you might test the spirit using Letter=
 cards 
 they can see and read off for you, there are all sorts of study's =
to 
develop  this work.  You need to see a lawyer in this area of pattens f=
irst, or 
the  old fashioned way would be to put the whole idea drawings wh=
atever, and 
take it  to post office, have them date stamp the thing, addre=
ssed to 
yourself, when it  arrives you put it away without opening it, at =
least that would 
be considered in  Court as a Copyright.  Get going!
 
 
I=
n a message dated 5/4/2009 3:40:49 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
purplealie=
ngirl@... writes:

 
 


Medical Science!? Really!? Are you FN kiddin=
g me!? A "science" that  is 
directly responsible for the deaths and suffer=
ing of hundreds of thousands  
every year by the use of drugs and practices=
 that supposedly underwent these  
bogus studies for safety and effectivene=
ss. That's your example of science?  
Where's the "science" when you can ma=
ke these studies show whatever you 
want,  or whatever someone paid for?  S=
cience is a big fat lie! 
 
 I do what I do for my own curiosity, I know it=
 works and I can show  it 
works for spirit communication, but I ain't jump=
in' through anyone's hoops!  
Not for science, or any other religion!
 
 Fr=
ank-S


On Mon, May 4, 2009 at 11:13 AM, Rj <_rasterer@..._ 
(mailto:=
rasterer@...) >  wrote:


 
 


Frank =E2=80=93 I think I disagree wi=
th you here.  Science  is not just about the 
evidence, it=E2=80=99s about =
the entire process,  including how the evidence is 
collected and how (and =
by whom) it is  interpreted.  This is why a valuable tool 
in the scientifi=
c  arsenal is the double (and triple) blind study.  It 
attempts to  remove=
 the often uncontrollable subjectivity inherent in all people, 
 even scien=
tists!  Science uses this technique to help keep even  itself as 
honest as=
 possible.  So if you are finding that the  evidence is being 
ignored, the=
 reason may not be the evidence itself  (no matter how compelling). 
It may=
 very well be the manner in which it  is collected, and interpreted: 
all a=
t least as important as the audio  itself.

EVP=E2=80=99s are perfectly all=
owed to throw monkey wrenches,  and even kitchen 
sinks into scientific the=
ories and accepted dogmas:  but only if they follow 
science=E2=80=99s rule=
s.  It=E2=80=99s like trying to put  a new medicine on the market with 
cla=
ims that it destroys accepted  dogmas: but, if the testing has not been 
ri=
gorous and up to accepted  medical standards, its hard to blame consumers 
=
for being doubtful of  its claims.

Science is not magic: it is a simple pr=
ocess  really, but it forces a claim 
to really be solidly confirmed. It se=
ems  to me that, while EVP research 
has its toe in the water of scientific=
  methodology (it is making 
observations, collecting evidence, and  making=
 theories), it seems to be obsessed on 
that phase of science,  and not on =
the hard part: designing and conducting 
objective tests to  conform or dis=
miss the theories.  It seems that so many 
people  are having so much fun w=
ith their audio devices and results, that they  
are maybe afraid of taking=
 it to the next step of serious testing,  maybe 
because of the risk this t=
esting could destroy their  fun.

But they should maybe consider it might N=
OT destroy their  fun, but instead 
that next phase of testing may be just =
what the  doctors ordered to bring 
EVP into mainline science: real,  scien=
ce-based testing.  I fear the people 
accepted as the real  experts and pio=
neers in this field (like you Frank) 
will never get any  acknowledgement o=
f their achievements unless they have are 
able to  move into this next pha=
se.

Science wants you to piss on its  fire, Frank.  But you have to go whe=
re 
the fire is.    And the way there is through the entire scientific meth=
od, not 
just  the early fun parts, but the hard testing parts.  But I  und=
erstand 
how difficult that prospect can be, and that it would take  your f=
ocus off 
the part you seem to like best (experimenting with the  equipment=
).  If you 
are unable to bring yourself to the testing  phase, it might be=
 worth looking 
at partnering up with others who  would focus on that part =
for you?  I think 
a very dynamic team of  people could be formed with you =
focused on the 
technology creation,  and they focused on the more mundane =
aspects of rigorous 
blind study  testing.  Do you think that would be valu=
able to you, and to the 
 field of EVP studies?

It's =
not that it can't be proven, it's that all evidence  is deemed 
unacceptabl=
e- -a convinient way to make uncompfortable  facts go away.  The fact is 
 =
most of the EVP evidence  pretty much contradicts, or at least throws a 
mo=
nkey wrench in many  so called scientific theories, and accepted dogma. Eve=
n 
 spiritualists don't accept that there's a technology for spirit  
commu=
nication, who needs a medium when you've got box?
 
 To me, it seems scienc=
e has done little over the last 500  years except 
proclaim themsles the wo=
rlds only experts and source of  all knowledge. All 
technological advancem=
ent is made by people  trying an idea to see what works, 
and running with =
it, not waiting  for peer review BS to tell her it doesn't 
work. Science i=
s a bunch  of fat old men sitting around a fire place in 
over stuffed chai=
rs  telling each other how smart they are! They don't want 
anyone  pissing=
 on the fire!
 
 Frank-S

You will never =
be able to  prove your methods scientifically, so why even 
try to argue wi=
th  them? Even if you were able to, they probably still 
wouldn't  believe =
it.
 
IMO, who cares? All that  matters is that you are getting something o=
ut of 
it. Besides,  maybe it isn't meant to be understood by certain peopl=
e. I 
have  always held the opinion that we will never scientifically prove=
  anything 
we do in the paranormal field, and I think that is no  accident=
. I think 
some people will never get anything out of it,  while others wil=
l excel in 
their knowledge, but it will be all  very personal.
 
It's all =
about what  constitutes enough proof for you personally. You have 
to go  w=
ith your gut on what is true spirit communication, and what  isn't. 
If no =
one ever agrees with you, so what?
 
April

 Same old story--don't accept=

someone-like me-does in fact at lea=
st  understand what conditions to create to make

sible. Yet y'all wonder why I have a case of  the 
ass all the time. All th=
e pompus self proclaimed egotisical  little dweebs

 I have gotten so much friggn' voices t=
hat can't  be explained as anything

 more than enough

 The stuff is simpl=
e-provide something for the  enitities to make their 
voices out of and the=
y will speak, no  friggin' mystery, no magic, no secret 
tecnology, no high=
  priest(ess) needed. 
 
 Frank-S

Frank, I think you misunderstood or m=
isread something  somewhere. The 
AAEVP/Sarah Estep Research Fund is not fo=
r  AAEVP to do the research, it's for 
them to fund OUTSIDE  organizations =
for THEIR scientific research on the study 
of  EVP. The Windbridge Institu=
te received some of this sponsor  money for 
what they called "Real-time EV=
P Conversations: A  Pilot Study." The method 
for this communication was *n=
ot*  based on radio sweep, nor traditional 
methods, so it's not  based on =
what I assume many people here are doing. And in  
fact, it *was* based on =
the creations of someone outside of  the USA, so I'm 
a little confused as =
to why all the hostility  toward AAEVP for putting up 
the money.

Sadly, r=
adio  sweep methods don't, and may not for a long time, get the  
respect o=
f the scientific community that it deserves (then  again, seems no 
form of=
 EVP does), but at least this current  research is a step in the right 
dir=
ection. I hope, when  Windbridge concludes their study, that it will 
suppo=
rt the  notion that there is apparent communication formed in ways  that 
c=
annot be explained by currently known and understood  laws of nature. THAT =

alone, in my opinion, would be a big plus  for all ITC communities, regard=
less 
of the method from which  that communication was received. What's the=
 old 
saying? "It  takes but one white crow to prove all crows are not blac=
k."  Any 
proof, derived from any EVP method, would be greatly  welcomed as=
 far as 
I'm concerned.

Margaret
